basics.name: David Macias
basics.label: Data Analyst
basics.summary: Versatile data professional with hands-on experience in data engineering, analytics, and machine learning. In my current role, I’ve been responsible for the full data workflow—from building pipelines and transforming data to developing models and delivering insights—effectively functioning as a data engineer, analyst, and scientist in one. I'm driven by solving real problems with scalable, data-driven solutions, and I bring a strong background in mathematics, statistics, and numerical analysis.

work.name: El Paso County
work.summary: Built data pipelines and improved data recall and accessibility across departments. Led to the development data analytics and data science accessability across departments.
highlights: Completed ETL from various sources, along with data wrangling to make data analysis functional
Created data pipelines for real-time reporting
Increased data accessibility for non-technical staff
Utilized Web APIs to improve training datasets
Used AI and Machine Learning methods to forecast budgeting needs

work.name: New Mexico State University
work.summary: Focused on predictive modeling and classification using AI and machine learning methods. Built and evaluated machine learning models, conducted data cleaning, and created visual dashboards for research outputs.
highlights: Developed predictive models using Python, TensorFlow, and scikit-learn
Created visualizations using PowerBI, Tableau and matplotlib
Led feature selection and metric optimization efforts

education.institution: University of Texas at El Paso

projects.name: Driving Telematics Analysis and Signal Processing
projects.summary: Processed raw phone sensor data (magnetometer, accelerometer, gyroscope, Euler angles) to derive usable driver behavior features. Modeled and predicted risky driving behaviors using XGBoost and other machine learning methods. Developed risk and safety scores for pricing strategies in insurance modeling.

projects.name: AI LLM Survey Analysis
projects.summary: Created an end-to-end pipeline analyzing surveys using a large language model to extract sentiment and identify positive/negative keywords. Applied NLP techniques, keyword extraction, classification, and sentiment analysis to derive trends from open-ended responses.

projects.name: X-Ray Signal Processing with AI and Machine Learning
projects.summary: Converted raw astronomical X-ray signal data into structured inputs for machine learning models. Used PCA, KMeans, and SGD to distinguish between stars, galaxies, and pulsars with a prediction accuracy of 96%.
